item.title: Blackberry is quietly trying to make a comeback — but not with phones
Has Blackberry Turned the Corner?
Android Circuit: Galaxy S8 Launch Date Leaks, Galaxy Note Returns, Fixing Google Pixel Problems
item.description: [at Forbes] - This week’s Android Circuit includes Samsung's new desktop mode for the Galaxy S8, two possible designs for the S8, the return of the Galaxy Note, how to fix the Google Pixel, BlackBerry's return at CES, OnePlus release Nougat based Oxygen OS, and a new guide to Material Design.

item.title: China's TCL out to revive BlackBerry smartphones
China's TCL out to revive BlackBerry smartphones
item.description: [AFP] - Chinese electronics company TCL Corporation was at CES with a plan to revive BlackBerry handsets knocked from the mobile phone throne by Apple and Google. TCL is putting its market clout behind the design, manufacture and marketing of a new portfolio of BlackBerry smartphones, trusting that its solid position in the market will renew faith in the brand. "What sells a product is confidence in your underlying capabilities and that there is a future," said Steve Cistulli, general manager for TCL Communication Technology Holdings Limited of North America.
